oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from G. F. Robinson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A letter from G. F. Robinson who was stationed at a camp near Spotsylvania, Virginia courthouse. See G. F. Robinson Letters, 1861-1864. TSLA Mf. #1969 for entire collection of Robinson letters. Describing Spotsylvania, "the battle field was the worst sight and smell ever sawOld Grant fought us harder than any other general ever did our loss is heavy threwout the army."
